intro: Peperomia butaguensis, commonly known as the Butagué peperomia, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are often variegated with shades of green, white, and pink. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. Peperomia butaguensis is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance requirements and ability to thrive in indirect light.
